title.narrative: INVESTMENT IN CHILDREN MONITORING

description.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Economy and Finance, the National Secretariat of Planning and Development and other decentralized ministries and autonomous governments have strengthened their systems to monitor investment in children and adolescents at the national and local levels, to measure multidimensional child poverty and to improve social protection, with an emphasis on emergency situations., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, mothers, children, adolescents and families, especially the most vulnerable (on the northern border, indigenous peoples, Afrodescendants and others) and/or in emergency situations, exercise their right to health, education, water and sanitation and to informed and effective participation, with a focus on early childhood and adolescence

mailing-address.narrative: Av. Amazonas 2889 y La Granja Edificio Naciones Unidas Quito

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Data analysis, including situation analysis and update
PF4C: Engagement with budget processes to improve social sector budgets (sufficiency, efficiency, effectiveness, transparency, equity)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Economy and Finance, the National Secretariat of Planning and Development and other decentralizedministries and autonomous governments have strengthened their systems to monitor investment in children and adolescents at thenational and local levels, to measure multidimensional child poverty and to improve social protection, with an emphasis onemergency situations.

description.narrative: To advance the delivery of results for children, UNICEF CO has periodically monitored the situation of children and their families through ENCOVID-19 rapid telephone surveys, and has advocated and promoted a policy dialogue focused on protecting and prioritizing children. The emphasis has been on a policymaking process with a strong focus on budget and based on high-quality knowledge products and evidence about poverty, social protection and public finance. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of documents analyzing social and economic policies impacting on children and adolescents. (67180)
Reports on child and adolescent social investment(67179)

actual.value: 2021:An analysis has been developed on social investment and social protection. Additionally, a strategy has been developed to make Ecuador's cash transfer programme more sensitive for children and reduce exclusion and inclusion errors.

title.narrative: National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures

baseline.value: Ecuador does not count with a methodology to measure multidimensional poverty on children.

actual.value: 2021:A report, jointly developed with the NSO and New School, on child and adolescents deprivations. This report is expected to be released in 2022
